title: Ukraine Moves Forward in South, With Little Resistance From Russia
description: A day after Russia said it was withdrawing from Kherson City in the south, Ukraine’s forces moved into villages without a fight, indicating the Russians were, indeed, retreating.

title: Qatar Will Allow Israelis to Fly Directly to Doha for World Cup
description: The move fell short of creating formal diplomatic ties between the countries, but it was the latest sign of warming relations between Israel and some Arab governments.

title: Your Friday Briefing: Xi and Biden to Meet
description: Plus cryptocurrency chaos and Ukraine’s wary advance toward Kherson.

title: Norwegian Princess Engaged to Shaman Gives Up Royal Duties
description: Princess Martha Louise’s belief in the supernatural has long been the subject of media fascination in Norway, but a focus on her healer fiancé proved too much.

title: How Europe Is Reacting to the Midterm Elections
description: With the MAGA star dimmed, analysts expect continued support in Washington for Ukraine and NATO, and perhaps greater pressure on China.

title: Orphaned in Afghanistan, Adopted in America: The Battle for Baby L.
description: Now 3, she lives with a U.S. Marine and his wife, but her Afghan family claims she was taken under false pretenses. A court may soon decide.

title: Biden and Xi Will Meet as Tensions Grow Over Taiwan
description: Setting a meeting gives the two leaders an opportunity for face-to-face time, but President Biden said he would deliver no “fundamental concessions” over Taiwan.

title: Brazil Counted All Its Votes in Hours. It Still Faces Fraud Claims.
description: A report from the military found no voter fraud — but left room for Bolsonaro’s supporters to argue maybe he’d actually won.

title: Russia and Ukraine Each Have Over 100,000 Casualties, Top US General Says
description: Gen. Mark Milley, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, called the coming winter months an opportune time for the two sides to hold peace talks.

title: 84 Years Later, a New Look at the Nazi Attacks of Kristallnacht
description: Newly released photographs of the assaults on Jews during the 1938 pogrom, which is widely commemorated as the start of the Holocaust, had been kept by a former American serviceman.

title: In France, an Outburst Is a Setback for the Far Right
description: For the first time, the National Rally is the main opposition party in Parliament. But can it use its new perch to convince voters it has changed?

title: Biden Under Pressure From All Corners for Climate Reparations
description: President Biden arrives in Egypt on Friday for COP27 to celebrate the new U.S. climate law. Other countries want to talk money.

title: Abortion on the Ballot
description: Democrats won crucial races in states where abortion rights were at stake.

title: Putin Will Not Attend the G20 Summit
description: The Russian delegation will be headed by Foreign Minister Sergey V. Lavrov, the RIA Novosti state news agency reported.

title: Putin Won’t Travel to G20 Summit, State News Media Say
description: Vladimir V. Putin will not go to next week’s Group of 20 meeting, which would have been his first appearance alongside Western leaders since his forces invaded Ukraine, Russian news agencies reported.

title: Egypt Starts ‘Medical Intervention’ on Prominent Political Prisoner, Family Says
description: The hunger-striking dissident Alaa Abd El Fattah escalated his protest this week when he stopped drinking water as a U.N.-sponsored climate conference opened in Egypt.

title: A Vatican Auditor Says He Dug Up Too Much Dirt, and Was Buried
description: Libero Milone is suing the Vatican for wrongful dismissal after he said he found cardinals siphoning off funds. The Vatican has hit him with a criminal investigation of its own.

title: Weed is Legal in Thailand. How Long Will the High Times Last?
description: Cannabis shops have multiplied since the drug was decriminalized, with caveats, in June. But some lawmakers are pushing for tighter regulation.

title: In an Age of Constant Disaster, What Does It Mean to Rebuild?
description: Each catastrophe is a test of what kind of society we’ve built. And each recovery offers a chance, however fleeting, to build another.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: Takeaways from the U.S. midterms.
